titles.title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to proclaim as reservation for the benefit of the Sault Ste. Marie Tribe of Chippewa Indians a parcel of land now held in trust by the United States for that Indian tribe.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 175.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 110-273.
Mrs. Christensen asked unanimous consent discharged from the Committee on the Whole on the State of the Union.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Hearings held.

bill.summary: 7/30/2007--Passed House amended. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to proclaim as reservation for the benefit of the Sault Ste. Marie Tribe of Chippewa Indians a specified parcel of land in Michigan now held in trust by the United States for the Tribe.States that the Secretary's proclamation shall be pursuant to section 7 of the Act of June 18, 1934 (relating to new Indian reservations), and shall be deemed effective as of April 19, 1988.
